page.title: 01Troutbeck valley - General
page.content: The survey area is dominated by the valley of the Trout beck and the village of the same name, running north to south in the western half of the area. The eastern half is an upland area reaching 478m. in the summit of Sour Howes. To the south, the valley opens out as the land descends towards Windermere. To the north, the valley extends further in to the higher and more rugged mass of the central Lakeland fells. Troutbeck is one of the most attractive villages in the whole region and is a tourist 'honey-pot'. "Town End" is a 16th century house owned by the National Trust and open to the public. The popularity of the village puts a lot of pressure on house prices and local people are not able to compete. The main Ullswater road runs through the valley.
